desc_content.paragraph: Returns the area size of the 2D or 3D triangle defined.

list_item.paragraph: v1 (mathutils.Vector) – Point1
v2 (mathutils.Vector) – Point2
v3 (mathutils.Vector) – Point3

desc_content.paragraph: Return a transformed point, the transformation is defined by 2 triangles.

list_item.paragraph: point (mathutils.Vector) – The point to transform.
tri_a1 (mathutils.Vector) – source triangle vertex.
tri_a2 (mathutils.Vector) – source triangle vertex.
tri_a3 (mathutils.Vector) – source triangle vertex.
tri_b1 (mathutils.Vector) – target triangle vertex.
tri_b2 (mathutils.Vector) – target triangle vertex.
tri_b3 (mathutils.Vector) – target triangle vertex.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns an angle that best fits the points to an axis aligned rectangle
Returns the normal of the 3D tri or quad.

field_body.paragraph: boxes (list) – list of boxes, each box is a list where the first 4 items are [x, y, width, height, …] other items are ignored.
the width and height of the packed bounding box

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a list of indices into the list given
Returns the signed distance between a point and a plane (negative when below the normal).

list_item.paragraph: pt (mathutils.Vector) – Point
plane_co (mathutils.Vector) – A point on the plane
plane_no (mathutils.Vector) – The direction the plane is facing

desc_content.paragraph: Interpolate a bezier spline segment.

list_item.paragraph: knot1 (mathutils.Vector) – First bezier spline point.
handle1 (mathutils.Vector) – First bezier spline handle.
handle2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second bezier spline handle.
knot2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second bezier spline point.
resolution (int) – Number of points to return.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a tuple with the points on each line respectively closest to the other.

list_item.paragraph: v1 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the first line
v2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the first line
v3 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the second line
v4 (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the second line

desc_content.paragraph: Takes 2 segments (defined by 4 vectors) and returns a vector for their point of intersection or None.

warning.paragraph: Despite its name, this function works on segments, and not on lines.

list_item.paragraph: lineA_p1 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the first line
lineA_p2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the first line
lineB_p1 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the second line
lineB_p2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the second line

field_body.paragraph: The point of intersection or None when not found

desc_content.paragraph: Calculate the intersection between a line (as 2 vectors) and a plane. Returns a vector for the intersection or None.

list_item.paragraph: line_a (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the first line
line_b (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the first line
plane_co (mathutils.Vector) – A point on the plane
plane_no (mathutils.Vector) – The direction the plane is facing

field_body.paragraph: The point of intersection or None when not found

desc_content.paragraph: Takes a line (as 2 points) and a sphere (as a point and a radius) and returns the intersection

list_item.paragraph: line_a (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the line
line_b (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the line
sphere_co (mathutils.Vector) – The center of the sphere
sphere_radius (sphere_radius) – Radius of the sphere

field_body.paragraph: The intersection points as a pair of vectors or None when there is no intersection
A tuple pair containing mathutils.Vector or None

desc_content.paragraph: Takes a line (as 2 points) and a sphere (as a point and a radius) and returns the intersection

list_item.paragraph: line_a (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the line
line_b (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the line
sphere_co (mathutils.Vector) – The center of the sphere
sphere_radius (sphere_radius) – Radius of the sphere

field_body.paragraph: The intersection points as a pair of vectors or None when there is no intersection
A tuple pair containing mathutils.Vector or None

desc_content.paragraph: Return the intersection between two planes

list_item.paragraph: plane_a_co (mathutils.Vector) – Point on the first plane
plane_a_no (mathutils.Vector) – Normal of the first plane
plane_b_co (mathutils.Vector) – Point on the second plane
plane_b_no (mathutils.Vector) – Normal of the second plane

field_body.paragraph: The line of the intersection represented as a point and a vector
tuple pair of mathutils.Vector or None if the intersection can’t be calculated

desc_content.paragraph: Takes a point and a line and returns a tuple with the closest point on the line and its distance from the first point of the line as a percentage of the length of the line.

list_item.paragraph: pt (mathutils.Vector) – Point
line_p1 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the line
line_p1 – Second point of the line

desc_content.paragraph: Takes 5 vectors (using only the x and y coordinates): one is the point and the next 4 define the quad, only the x and y are used from the vectors. Returns 1 if the point is within the quad, otherwise 0. Works only with convex quads without singular edges.

list_item.paragraph: pt (mathutils.Vector) – Point
quad_p1 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the quad
quad_p2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the quad
quad_p3 (mathutils.Vector) – Third point of the quad
quad_p4 (mathutils.Vector) – Fourth point of the quad

desc_content.paragraph: Takes 4 vectors: one is the point and the next 3 define the triangle.

list_item.paragraph: pt (mathutils.Vector) – Point
tri_p1 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the triangle
tri_p2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the triangle
tri_p3 (mathutils.Vector) – Third point of the triangle

field_body.paragraph: Point on the triangles plane or None if its outside the triangle

desc_content.paragraph: Takes 4 vectors (using only the x and y coordinates): one is the point and the next 3 define the triangle. Returns 1 if the point is within the triangle, otherwise 0.

list_item.paragraph: pt (mathutils.Vector) – Point
tri_p1 (mathutils.Vector) – First point of the triangle
tri_p2 (mathutils.Vector) – Second point of the triangle
tri_p3 (mathutils.Vector) – Third point of the triangle

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the intersection between a ray and a triangle, if possible, returns None otherwise.

list_item.paragraph: v1 (mathutils.Vector) – Point1
v2 (mathutils.Vector) – Point2
v3 (mathutils.Vector) – Point3
ray (mathutils.Vector) – Direction of the projection
orig (mathutils.Vector) – Origin
clip (boolean) – When False, don’t restrict the intersection to the area of the triangle, use the infinite plane defined by the triangle.

field_body.paragraph: The point of intersection or None if no intersection is found

desc_content.paragraph: Returns 2 points on between intersecting circles.

list_item.paragraph: p_a (mathutils.Vector) – Center of the first circle
radius_a (float) – Radius of the first circle
p_b (mathutils.Vector) – Center of the second circle
radius_b (float) – Radius of the second circle

field_body.paragraph: tuple of mathutils.Vector’s or None when there is no intersection

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the normal of a 3D polygon.

field_body.paragraph: vectors (sequence of 3 or more 3d vector) – Vectors to calculate normals with

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a list of points inside all planes given and a list of index values for the planes used.

field_body.paragraph: planes (list of mathutils.Vector) – List of planes (4D vectors).
two lists, once containing the vertices inside the planes, another containing the plane indices used

desc_content.paragraph: Takes a list of polylines (each point a vector) and returns the point indices for a polyline filled with triangles.
Return the volume formed by a tetrahedron (points can be in any order).

list_item.paragraph: v1 (mathutils.Vector) – Point1
v2 (mathutils.Vector) – Point2
v3 (mathutils.Vector) – Point3
v4 (mathutils.Vector) – Point4
